etymology.description: 區(區) (qū, "district") originally consists of 匸(匸) (xì, "box") + 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") = representation of multiple people within an enclosed area -> simplification: 品(金) (pǐn, "many people") changed to 乂(乂) (yì, "to govern") for ease
etymology.interpretation: The character 區(區) (qū, "district") visually represented an area containing many people, signifying a district. The simplification to 区(區) (qū, "district") replaced 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") with 乂(乂) (yì, "to govern") which is visually less complex and more cursive-friendly.
etymology.simplification: The original character 區(區) (qū, "district") was simplified to 区(區) (qū, "district") by replacing 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") with the simpler 乂(乂) (yì, "to govern"), making it easier to write and remember while maintaining the sense of an enclosed area.

examples.chinese: 城市按功能分成多个区(城市按功能分成多個區)，各区各具特色(各區各具特色)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngshì àn gōngnéng fēnchéng duō gè qū, gè qū gè jù tèsè.
examples.english: The city is divided into several districts based on function, and each district has its own distinct characteristics.

examples.chinese: 古城设有历史文化区(古城設有歷史文化區)，保护传统韵味(保護傳統韻味)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔchéng shè yǒu lìshǐ wénhuà qū, bǎohù chuántǒng yùnwèi.
examples.english: The ancient city has a historical and cultural district that preserves its traditional charm.

examples.chinese: 现代城区扩展到郊区(現代城區擴展到郊區)，新区正在迅速发展(新區正在迅速發展)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàndài chéngqū kuòzhǎn dào jiāoqū, xīn qū zhèngzài xùnsù fāzhǎn.
examples.english: The modern urban area has expanded into suburban regions, and the new zone is developing rapidly.
